Question
========

Research shows that 22% of all adults are interested in a trip to Mars. Of these adults, 75% are under the age of 26. As we assume that age and interest are independent of each other are, what is the probability that a randomly selected adult will be someone is someone who wants to go to Mars and is older than 26?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,06
* 0,17
* 0,22
* 0,25

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.06: Correct
* 0.17: Incorrect
* 0.22: Incorrect
* 0.25: Incorrect
